data.title: How many coin combinations?
data.statement:
You want to give someone a certain amount of money in change (i.e. in coins).

You have unlimited quarters, dimes, and nickels -- worth $0.25, $0.10, and $0.05 respectively. 
(No pennies)

How many different combinations ([[diffCombos]]) of coins can you choose from?

Example:
$0.35 has 6 [[diffCombos]], namely:
(1) 1 quarter, 1 dime
(2) 1 quarter, 2 nickels
(3) 3 dimes, 1 nickel
(4) 2 dimes, 3 nickels
(5) 1 dime, 5 nickels
(6) 7 nickels
data.stubGenerator:
read num:int
loop num read idPlusMoneyAmt:string(100)
write number of coin combos
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[num]], stating how many lines to follow
<<next [[num]] Lines:>> A string [[idPlusMoneyAmt]], consisting of:
an [[id]], which is an integer in parentheses
followed by a space
followed by the [[moneyAmount]] including {{$}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You want to give someone a certain amount of money in change (i.e. in coins).

You have unlimited quarters, dimes, and nickels -- worth $0.25, $0.10, and $0.05 respectively.
(No pennies)

How many different combinations (diffCombos) of coins can you choose from?

Example:
$0.35 has 6 diffCombos, namely:
(1) 1 quarter, 1 dime
(2) 1 quarter, 2 nickels
(3) 3 dimes, 1 nickel
(4) 2 dimes, 3 nickels
(5) 1 dime, 5 nickels
(6) 7 nickels
Input
Line 1: An integer num, stating how many lines to follow
next num Lines: A string idPlusMoneyAmt, consisting of:
an id, which is an integer in parentheses
followed by a space
followed by the moneyAmount including $
Output
num Lines: id (from input) diffCombos (separated by a space)
Constraints
$0.05 ≤ moneyAmount ≤ $50.00

moneyAmount ends with 0 or 5
Example
Input
8
(1) $0.35
(2) $0.05
(3) $0.15
(4) $0.25
(5) $0.70
(6) $0.85
(7) $0.30
(8) $0.80
Output
(1) 6
(2) 1
(3) 2
(4) 4
(5) 16
(6) 22
(7) 5
(8) 20
